meanings.definition: Characteristic of being studious or intellectual.
meanings.sent1: Her bookishness nature was evident in her love for reading and research.
meanings.sent2: The professor's bookishness demeanor made him a respected authority in the academic community.
meanings.sent3: Despite his bookishness appearance, he surprised everyone with his athletic abilities.
meanings.sent4: The bookishness aura surrounding her made her the go-to person for literary recommendations.
meanings.sent5: His bookishness habits included spending hours in the library, surrounded by stacks of books.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being bookish.
meanings.sent1: Her bookishness was evident in the way she always had a book in hand.
meanings.sent2: The bookishness of the library created a cozy atmosphere for readers.
meanings.sent3: His bookishness was so extreme that he even read during his lunch breaks.
meanings.sent4: The bookishness of the bookstore transported her to different worlds with each turn of a page.
meanings.sent5: The bookishness of the book club members was infectious, inspiring others to read more.
